ArticleTitle.sentence: Downstream activation of a TATA-less promoter by Oct-2, Bob1, and NF-kappaB directs expression of the homing receptor BLR1 to mature B cells.

AbstractText.sentence: The chemokine receptor, BLR1, is a major regulator of the microenvironmental homing of B cells in lymphoid organs.

event.clue: The chemokine receptor, BLR1, is a major regulator of the microenvironmental homing of B cells in lymphoid organs.
The chemokine receptor, BLR1, is a major regulator of the microenvironmental homing of B cells in lymphoid organs.

AbstractText.sentence: In vitro studies identify three essential elements of the TATA-less blr1 core promoter that confer cell type- and differentiation-specific expression in the B cells of both humans and mice, a functional promoter region (-36 with respect to the transcription start site), a NF-kappaB motif (+44), and a noncanonical octamer motif (+157).

event.clue: In vitro studies identify three essential elements of the TATA-less blr1 core promoter that confer cell type- and differentiation-specific expression in the B cells of both humans and mice, a functional promoter region (-36 with respect to the transcription start site), a NF-kappaB motif (+44), and a noncanonical octamer motif (+157).

In vitro studies identify three essential elements of the TATA-less blr1 core promoter that confer cell type- and differentiation-specific expression in the B cells of both humans and mice, a functional promoter region (-36 with respect to the transcription start site), a NF-kappaB motif (+44), and a noncanonical octamer motif (+157).

In vitro studies identify three essential elements of the TATA-less blr1 core promoter that confer cell type- and differentiation-specific expression in the B cells of both humans and mice, a functional promoter region (-36 with respect to the transcription start site), a NF-kappaB motif (+44), and a noncanonical octamer motif (+157).

AbstractText.sentence: The importance of these sites was confirmed by in vivo studies in gene-targeted mice deficient of either Oct-2, Bob1, or both NF-kappaB subunits p50 and p52.
In all of these animals, the expression of BLR1 was reduced or absent.

event.clue: In all of these animals, the expression of BLR1 was reduced or absent.
In all of these animals, the expression of BLR1 was reduced or absent.
In all of these animals, the expression of BLR1 was reduced or absent.

AbstractText.sentence: In mice deficient only of p52/NF-kappaB, BLR1 expression was unaffected.

event.clue: In mice deficient only of p52/NF-kappaB, BLR1 expression was unaffected.
In mice deficient only of p52/NF-kappaB, BLR1 expression was unaffected.

AbstractText.sentence: Thus our data demonstrate that BLR1 is a target gene for Oct-2, Bob1, and members of the NF-kappaB/Rel family and provides a link to the impaired B cell functions in mice deficient for these factors.
